Summary An innovative, energetic marketer with 6.5 years of experience in B2B, B2C and product marketing, with an EMEA and international focus. Passionate about the startup and developer community, serving as a an advisor to numerous start-ups.  
 
A creative storyteller with strong record of managing brands, creating impact and inspiring others. Self-starter with hands-on mentality. Highly analytical problem-solver thriving in international, challenging environments. 
 
Representing Google at external events; held a talk at the Bloomberg Innovation Summit about innovation at Google, spoke at the London School of Economics Career Fair about working at Google. 
 
Specialties: Product Marketing, Brand Management & Communications, Content Creation, Curation & Marketing, Strategic Planning, Events, Video Advertising, Mobile Advertising, SEM, Social Media, Partner Management, Strategic Partnerships. 
 
Things I am most proud of: 
- Leading the YouTube B2B marketing activity across the EMEA region 
- Being the global Marketing Lead for the Consumer Barometer in 2014. The Consumer Barometer was shortlisted in the Webby’s awards, IAB Europe Research Awards, Mediatel’s Connected Consumer Awards 
- Overseeing the Marketing & Comms of Google’s presence in 2014 Cannes Lions Festival 
- Volunteering for SEWA Bharat as part of the Google Reach Leadership Program

- Being involved  Experience Product Marketing Manager, YouTube Ads & Research Communications Google October 2013  – Present (1 year 11 months) London, United Kingdom EMEA Programme Lead - YouTube Ads  
Currently leading all YouTube Ads programmes in EMEA working cross-functionally across 17 markets, PR and LCS.  
Creating the central marketing strategy, from key objectives and mission, to customer touchpoints, product launches and resource planning

Global Product Marketing Lead - Consumer Barometer  
Led the global launch of Google's Consumer Barometer, a free tool that delivers consumer insights to support media planning and decision-making. Created go-to-market strategy and led its implementation managing stakeholders among the Market Insights, PR and country marketing teams  
One of the most successful research-related launches with record number of visitors, time-on-site and PR coverage 
 
Project Co-Lead - Google Executive Summit

Project Co-Lead - WellVersed (20% role)

Summary When a process is broken or non-existent, I figure out who to work with to make things work right in a scalable manner. When a situation is urgent and important, I drop everything to make it turn out right. When a project is fun and creative, I rejoice in the opportunity to make something new and distinctive. 
 
As a marketer, my biggest tools are creative thinking, strategic partnerships, clear communication, and persistence. I've also been honing skills from my administrative background like project management, strong writing and quantitative analysis, calm in hectic situations, and comfort in liaising with everyone from programmers to caterers to executives. Summary I'm a marketer at Google with 10 years of experience in sales and marketing. I help product and marketing teams across Google think about mobile strategy and user growth. I work on apps like Search, Gmail, Youtube, Chrome, Maps, etc. 
 
Prior to this, I spent most of my years helping small businesses around the world get the most out of the web. I contributed to the launch of Google Places, Google+ Pages, and more recently Google My Business. I also spent a lot of my time thinking about onboarding, growing and retaining customers on AdWords, AdWords Express, Helpouts by Google and Google Shopping Express. 
 
I relocated over 3 years ago to California to work at Google headquarters in Mountain View. I studied, worked and lived in Europe, Latin America, and the US. I have a MSc degree in Engineering from Telecom Sud Paris and attended one MBA course semester at EGADE - Tec de Monterrey.

Summary Business professional with a varied skill set across marketing and sales. Proven track record of excelling in a fast-paced and results-oriented environment, coupled with the ability to jump seamlessly between analytical/creative marketing responsibilities and consultative sales functions. Passion for creating positive in the world through my talents, energy, and work ethic. 
 
Past: Cut my teeth from 2010 to 2013 on search, display, and video executions for Google's biggest clients - most notably in the spaces of e-commerce and omni-channel retailing. Moved to London in 2013 to work on Finance brands as they figured out branded video content on YouTube.  
 
Present: Came back stateside and moved into the prestigious APMM program, learning the client side of the business across creative, growth, and product. Focused on the launch and development of Google's gTLD strings, as well as the day-to-day management of the company's domain portfolio. Since then, I've become one of the first marketers on Google Domains, touching every aspect of the marketing mix for the new business. Moved to Google Maps marketing in April of 2015, managing all social channels as well as working on traditional product marketing.  
 
When I'm not @ the Googleplex, some consider me one of the country's most promising young magicians. I perform for an array of prestigious clients nationwide under my stage name of David Gerard. I write, direct, and produce a one-man show that has sold out for over 4 years straight in the Bay Area.
